transcript.text: What do you need to bear in mind when it comes to gifts? Click on each heading to learn more.

contentText.text: Ask yourself the following questions before giving or accepting a gift:

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

tabText.text:
• Will the gift help build the business relationship?
  • Are there any upcoming business decisions? If so, could this gift look like an attempt to influence them?
  • How would this look to an independent observer?
  • Special rules apply when dealing with government clients. Check the DoA for your business and ensure you observe both our gift limits and pre-approval requirements.

• Excessive or extravagant gifts can send the wrong message, so they’re rarely, if ever, appropriate.
  • Keep gifts customary and reasonable for the circumstances, and document all gifts accurately and honestly.
  • Gifts worth USD$200 or more should be reported using the Gift Reporting Form.
  • Gifts given to government officials require pre-approval using the AB Form.

• Gifts should help build goodwill and trust in a business relationship and must never represent an attempt to affect the recipient’s independent judgment.
  • Giving the gift to gain a business advantage is always inappropriate, regardless of the value.

tab.tabName: What is the frequency of giving?

tabText.text:
• Even small gifts can add up over time.
  • Avoid frequently giving or receiving gifts or entertainment, particularly when it involves the same customer or business partner.
  • Any gifts or entertainment involving government officials require pre-approval.
